intro: Bosistoa pentacocca subsp. pentacocca, commonly known as the five-lobed bosistoa, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests.
